div.style: display: inline-block; background-color: #d9e0e7; padding: 6px; margin: 4px; border: 1px solid #8da1b4; border-radius: 5px; line-height: 60%

ul.li:
Include ces codes sont définis dans 1.3.6.1.4.1.19376.1.8.2.1
CodeDisplay
1258pT0: No evidence of primary tumor
1259pTis: Carcinoma in situ
1260pT1: Tumor 2 cm or less in greatest dimension
1261pT2: Tumor more than 2 cm but not more than 4 cm in greatest dimension
1262pT3: Tumor more than 4 cm in greatest dimension - Oropharynx : or extension to lingual surface of epiglottis
1263pT4a: Moderately advanced local disease. Lip: Tumor invades through cortical bone, inferior alveolar nerve, floor of mouth, or skin of face, ie, chin or nose - Oral cavity: Tumor invades adjacent structures only (eg, through cortical bone [mandible, maxilla], into deep [extrinsic] muscle of tongue [genioglossus, hyoglossus, palatoglossus, and styloglossus], maxillary sinus, skin of face) - Oropharynx : Tumor invades larynx, deep/extrinsic muscle of tongue, medial pterygoid muscles, hard palate, or mandible
1264pT4b: Very advanced local disease. Tumor invades masticator space, pterygoid plates, or skull base, and/or encases internal carotid artery - Oropharynx: Tumor invades lateral pterygoid muscle, pterygoid plates, lateral nasopharynx, or skull base, or encases carotid artery

publisher.value: Agence du Numérique en Santé(ANS) -2 - 10 Rue d'Oradour-sur-Glane, 75015 Paris

display.value: pT0: No evidence of primary tumor
pT1: Tumor 2 cm or less in greatest dimension
pT2: Tumor more than 2 cm but not more than 4 cm in greatest dimension
pT3: Tumor more than 4 cm in greatest dimension - Oropharynx : or extension to lingual surface of epiglottis

pT4a: Moderately advanced local disease. Lip: Tumor invades through cortical bone, inferior alveolar nerve, floor of mouth, or skin of face, ie, chin or nose - Oral cavity: Tumor invades adjacent structures only (eg, through cortical bone [mandible, maxilla], into deep [extrinsic] muscle of tongue [genioglossus, hyoglossus, palatoglossus, and styloglossus], maxillary sinus, skin of face) - Oropharynx : Tumor invades larynx, deep/extrinsic muscle of tongue, medial pterygoid muscles, hard palate, or mandible

pT4b: Very advanced local disease. Tumor invades masticator space, pterygoid plates, or skull base, and/or encases internal carotid artery - Oropharynx: Tumor invades lateral pterygoid muscle, pterygoid plates, lateral nasopharynx, or skull base, or encases carotid artery
